group_1.textLeft: ...Looks like it's a progress report on the@kofun excavation.

group_1.textRight: Ah, THAT one!@The one you discovered, Komachi-senpai!
I was so surprised when I heard about it!
That whole hill behind the school, secretly@being a kofun all along...
If you're talking to Komachi, she can't hear@you.
No, I was just saying how I surprised I was@about the hill being a kofun.

group_1.textLeft: I was pretty surprised myself, too.

group_1.textRight: You know, a conversation like this almost makes@it feel like we're a real Historical Research Club!

group_1.textLeft: You could've left out the words "almost" and@"real".

group_1.textRight: ...Speaking of which, we hadn't even formed the@club yet at the time.

group_1.textLeft: ...It really wasn't that long ago, was it?

group_1.narration: On that day, I'd decided to visit@the large hill behind our school.
From what I had heard,@the city had started a project to bulldoze the hill@and make way for a bypass.
There was a stone monument near the foot of the hill,@dedicated to the Shishi during the Meiji Restoration.
Since visiting historical sites is a hobby of mine,@I particularly liked the spot.
...So I wanted to see it one last time@before construction started.

group_1.textCenter: (There's the monument... I guess this'll be the@last time I get to see it here.)
(Yeah, that's right.@Are they going to bulldoze the whole hill...?)
(May as well take a little hike. This place@won't be around much longer, after all.)
(Why'd I go climbing up here on a whim?!@I'm still in my school uniform!)
(I could turn back... but, well, I'm almost at@the top already.)
